channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Killamarsh deaths: Man charged with murders of three children and woman
item.description: Damien Bendall is accused of killing Terri Harris and three children at a house in Derbyshire.

item.title: Manchester flooding: Major incident after burst water main
item.description: Two busy Manchester city centre roads are shut after a large water main bursts near the university.

item.title: Insulate Britain: Injunction granted against M25 protesters
item.description: National Highways wins a High Court ruling against protesters who have been disrupting the M25.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Family aim to 'forge ahead' with criminal case
item.description: Harry Dunn's mother, Charlotte Charles, says the resolution of a civil case is a relief.

item.title: HMP Bronzefield baby death: Mother was 'failed' says inspectors
item.description: Inspectors say the death of the newborn baby at HMP Bronzefield "should never have happened'.

item.title: One dead and two injured in shooting
item.description: Officers found a man, believed to be in his early 20s, with fatal bullet wounds on Green Lanes.

item.title: Windsor Castle reveals huge equestrian production for Platinum Jubilee
item.description: A Gallop Through History will take place in the grounds of Windsor Castle in May.

item.title: Man stabbed to death in street fight
item.description: Police find the victim, believed to be in his 30s, with multiple stab injuries on East Ferry Road.

item.title: Rhamero West: Greater Manchester Police refers itself to watchdog
item.description: Rhamero West, 16, was stabbed to death after being chased through the streets in Old Trafford.

item.title: Cleveland police and crime chief Steve Turner admits accepting caution
item.description: Steve Turner says he accepted the police caution after "an event" at a supermarket where he worked.

item.title: '#MeToo gave me confidence to report my sexual abuse'
item.description: Lucy Churchill says the movement led her to report sexual abuse committed against her 25 years ago.

item.title: Airport motion 'as useful as chocolate teapot'
item.description: Metro mayor Dan Norris wins support for his opposition to plans to welcome millions more passengers.

item.title: Tyneside foodbank's concerns over Universal Credit cut
item.description: Hebburn Helps fears there will be a rise in foodbank users as the Â£20 Universal Credit uplift goes.

item.title: Drink driver's erratic journey captured on his own dashcam
item.description: Footage shows David Leahy knocking down a street sign, mounting kerbs and hitting a parked car.

item.title: Lillie's virtual Ben Nevis fundraising challenge
item.description: The 10-year-old with cerebral palsy is covering the length of a mountain trail at home.

item.title: Ipswich runner Millie King: 'You've got to be the best you can be'
item.description: The 16-year-old sprinter gets two England call-ups after focusing on training during the pandemic.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: East Midlands Railway breached advertising rules by axing prize
item.description: The company withdrew a Â£5,000 prize asking the public for creative suggestions to improve journeys.

item.title: Rachel Daly goal for England in Luxembourg 'special' following father's death
item.description: Rachel Daly's goal for England following the death of her father was "special", says Lionesses boss Sarina Wiegman.

item.title: County Championship: Pick your team of the 2021 season
item.description: Who's impressed you in the County Championship this summer? Pick your team of the 2021 season using our selector.

item.title: Richard Marshall: Salford Red Devils coach leaves after one season
item.description: Salford Red Devils part company with head coach Richard Marshall by mutual consent, after one season in charge of the Super League club.

item.title: QPR 2-2 Everton (8-7 pens): Rafael Benitez's side knocked out by Championship QPR on penalties
item.description: Championship side QPR upset Everton on penalties, after 2-2 draw, to reach the last 16 of the Carabao Cup.
